RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 16750. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REBECCA G showed early speed and found herself on the front end attending the pace, while she ran in the three path, showed the way around the course until she was briefly threatened by an outside foe at the five sixteenth pole, was able to keep that challenger at bay, drifted in and out a bit in the late stretch, still raced a game a race and was up for the win. SEE SASSY RUN left a bit slow, was rushed onto her feet and put into the race right away passing horses from the five path, was cued at the five sixteenth pole but didn't have enough to over come the eventual winner and chased through the lane but was able to earn place honors. NEW YEAR'S PARTY stalked the early leader from the four path, was in contention early but had no finish. A. K. A. GRAMS was off a step slow, then was keen in the bridle for the first quarter of a mile, settled along the fence and tracked the early leaders, maintained her position into the furlong grounds then gave way. COMMERCIAL FLASH showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: A. K. A. Grams
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Commercial Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Rebecca G
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, led, 3w, challenged 5-16th, repelled, gamely won

ENTRY.NAME: See Sassy Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start, 5w, rushed, chased, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: New Year's Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, no late kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 1 1/16M Turf CR: 80. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf cou rse, it will be run on the main track at 1 1/16 Miles) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHIEF CHARLIE was strong out of the gates was determined to be near the front of the field, was angled into the three path saving ground in the first turn, while being rated off of the early leader, settled into a stalking position and was patiently waiting for the cue by the half mile marker, launched a bid after the three eighths pole, easily took command of the race by the quarter pole, and drew off willingly. ELUSIVE D'ORO was mid pack early on, raced in between foes and had to steady for a stride, started to slowly gain ground and improve position with every stride while racing in the four path, was stalking the early leaders by the second bend and was able to continue to gain momentum and close deep into the stretch, couldn't get to the eventual winner but was up for second. HELIOCHROME took the early lead and comfortably set the early fractions, saved ground through out, was challenged after the quarter pole, battled with and outside foe, was over come by that challenger but kept on gamely until into the furlong ground where he gave way late but had done enough work early to sustain the show spot. OBVIOUSLY TOO stalked the pace from the two path, was briefly joined by two other competitors and advanced after the half mile, sustained a mild bid. DECLARE WAR raced off of the pace from the two path, improved position and was mid pack by the half mile pole, took a ground saving trip, but had no late kick. MOUNTAIN BREEZE raced off of the pace, advanced into mid pack by the half mile pole, while racing from the outside, but was never a threat. MAGAZINE STREET showed little. NO KA OI was racing wide and was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Heliochrome
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, in hands, advanced 1/2, saved ground, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Declare War
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 2w, 7 wide, upper stretch, lacked late kick

ENTRY.NAME: No Ka Oi
ENTRY.COMMENT: wide, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Obviously Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Mountain Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, moved up 1/2 4w, was no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Elusive d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, between, steadied, made one run, closed up for second

ENTRY.NAME: Chief Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated, 3w, given rein 1/2, took command 1/4, repelled, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Magazine Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIONS NOT SHEEP was rated just off the early leaders and stalked from the five path, gained ground and advanced at the seven sixteenth, was accompanied by an inside foe briefly, passed the early leader, repelled his company challenger and drew off as he pleased in the stretch. ROOSTER RUN had an awkward start, lost ground in the first few jumps, was allowed to settle a bit and find his best stride, then was encouraged to make up ground from the four path, continued to be pushed and driven to keep improving position, gained momentum through the turn and was in contention after the quarter pole, though he could not get near the eventual winner, he was able to pass the other early leader and finish with a game second. BIG SCULLY was forwardly placed early on, raced in between foes after the half, advanced along with the eventual winner through the turn but could not keep pace with that rival and gave way late. SHADY GRADY was never involved. NOOGE vied for the lead, set the pace, was collared by outside rivals and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Nooge
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Shady Grady
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Rooster Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, off pace, rallied 1/2, 4w, encouraged, closed,

ENTRY.NAME: Big Scully
ENTRY.COMMENT: in between, challenged, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Lions Not Sheep
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated, staked, bid 5w, repelled challengers, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 40. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BE BO vied for the lead, settled just off the pace in hands while racing in the four path, patiently waited until she was asked at the three eights pole, responded confidently as she collared the early leaders, took control and easily drew away. PAYNT THE MOON vied for the early lead, matched strides and co led with another contender while being on the inside, saved ground through out, was collared at the three eighths pole by the eventual winner, but was allowed to catch her breath leaving the second turn giving her the edge after the sixteenth pole where she was able to repel and outside challenger and out finish the rest of the field and earn place honors. BISTINEAU BELLE was allowed settle clear off the pace early, raced at her own pace until the half mile marker where she was edged into the four path and launched bid, gaining ground and improving with every stride, was in touch with the field at the three eighths pole, was asked and responded with a nice turn of foot as she closed in on the eventual winner but tired late and had to settle for third. GREER CROSSING vied, matched strides with an insider rival from the three path as they set the pace, was caught by an outside challenger at the three eighths pole and gave way. MALLORI'S MAGIC broke a bit slow, raced well off the pace early along the inside, was asked at the half mile marker, inched out into the four path as she launched a late closing bid, but it wasn't enough today. SENSING GOLD was racing mid pack, was pushed to start gaining ground down the backside, was gaining momentum with every stride, but then had to steady into the turn and was through after that.

ENTRY.NAME: Paynt the Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, pace, rail, closed, out finished the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Bistineau Belle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off the pace, 2w 1st turn, 4w, moved 3/8, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Sensing Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rushed, steadied, quit

ENTRY.NAME: Mallori's Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, late bid, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Greer Crossing
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched strides with leader 3w, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Be Bo
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, settled off pace, stalked, 4w, bid 3/8, led 1/4, drew off,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 5F Turf CR: 78. Allowance Purse 30000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 20, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LA MORENA settled off the pace, raced in the four path, was asked and responded at the half mile pole, gained ground and was in touch with the field by the quarter pole, angled in entering the stretch, continued to close while splitting horses at the sixteenth pole caught the early leader within the last few jumps and was up for a very nice win. AMALFI SKY took advantage of the one post position and went to the front, attended the pace while saving ground, led all the way into the furlong ground where she was caught by another rival late and had to settle for second place today. B'S LIL' BUMBLEBEE raced off the pace while saving ground, was able to improve position through the turn and out finished the rest. CONDESA'S HANDMAID vied for the early lead, raced in between foes while being forwardly placed in the three path, maintained position until she tired late. SAY WHAT was mid pack through out but to no avail. EXPECT OURS mild bid, no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Amalfi Sky
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, rail. showed the way, caught late,

ENTRY.NAME: B's Lil' Bumblebee
ENTRY.COMMENT: off the pace, rail, out finished the rest

ENTRY.NAME: Condesa's Handmaid
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, in between, 3w, tired late

ENTRY.NAME: Expect Ours
ENTRY.COMMENT: mild bid, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Say What
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: La Morena
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp, took back, stalked, 4w, 2w stretch, split, game win

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Three Year Olds Prefer red).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAJUN ACES vied for the lead, set the pace while matching strides with another rival from the three path, was given the cue at the three eighths pole, responded well and took command, led into the stretch and was uncontested for the win. KITIARA vied for the lead, matched strides with eventual winner until the three eighths pole, failed to go on with that one, was still in contention late but struggled to switch leads and tired. SHE'S HAMAZING was off slow, raced along the inside in the two path, was asked at the half mile pole and launched a long steady bid, angled out six wide in the stretch and was up for third. THAT YOU MARGARET was no menace. BEAUTIFULGUATEMALA mild bid, inside. STAR POSE was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Beautifulguatemala
ENTRY.COMMENT: mild bid, inside

ENTRY.NAME: She's Hamazing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, made one run late, 6w, stretch, out finished others

ENTRY.NAME: Kitiara
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched, chased, struggled to switch leads, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Aces
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, matched, asked 3/8 pulled away, game win

ENTRY.NAME: Star Pose
ENTRY.COMMENT: was no factor

ENTRY.NAME: That You Margaret
ENTRY.COMMENT: was no menace

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 32000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LAURI'S WISH stalked the pace along the rail, was able to keep draw along side the pace setters and secure the rail going into the turn, gained ground in the turn and was able to draw off in the stretch. VODKA GIMLET raced off of the pace, moved up after the half mile pole, angled out into the six path in the upper stretch, and was up for second. HOSTILE AFLEET settled off the pace, moved at the half mile marker, made one run, angled out into the six path in the stretch. OUR FREDDIE MAC was five wide on the lead, was in contention and in front in the stretch then faltered. WISE ANCHOR was racing in the three path from in between horses on the front end, tired after the half mile pole. AZTAR showed little. HAIL STATE was in between horses on the lead in the four path, and stopped after the half mile pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Lauri's Wish
ENTRY.OWNER: Stewart, Chad J. and Lenci, Anthony
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, stalked, saved ground, up for the win

ENTRY.NAME: Vodka Gimlet
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, advanced 1/2, angled out 6w 1/4, closed, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Anchor
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, lead, between, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Hail State
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, in between, lead, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Our Freddie Mac
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, lead, in contention, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Aztar
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Hostile Afleet
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off the pace, moved 1/2, one run, angled out stretch, 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1M Turf CR: 76. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed i nadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DARE TO FAIL raced from well off the pace early, moved at the half mile pole, closed and was up just in time. BELLO CREEDO set the pace while saving ground, led throughout and was caught late. GOROSTIETA'S LOVE raced mid pack and maintained that position through out. DARK MATTER was no factor. MAKE YOUR DESTINY was no menace. WESTERN STAR showed little. PINK HIGGINS brief speed, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Western Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Bello Creedo
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, led, caught late, settled for second

ENTRY.NAME: Dare to Fail
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, moved 1/2, closed, up just in time

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Denali Stud, Rigney Racing LLC, S.D.Brilie L. P. & Brad Ra

ENTRY.NAME: Make Your Destiny
ENTRY.COMMENT: was no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Dark Matter
ENTRY.COMMENT: was no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Gorostieta's Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, raced even

ENTRY.NAME: Pink Higgins
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed brief speed, faltered
